-1.title: Sex Workers or Victims
-1.plot: In the U.S., the standard practice is to prosecute American juvenile prostitutes as criminal sex workers and lock them up with no counseling or assistance when they get out to help them build new lives and stay off the street. There are no comprehensive laws, federal or state, protecting these children - arguably the victims of statutory rape- and too few facilities to offer them the help they need. Lisa Ling investigates this issue, speaking with current and former juvenile prostitutes, riding along with law enforcement officers trying to stop the pimps, and going ...

2.title: Daughters Left Behind
2.plot: If a mother is in prison, what happens to her children? Women are being arrested, tried and convicted in record numbers-and the majority of women in prison are mothers. Since mothers are often the primary or sole caregivers to their children, their incarceration can destroy a family. The displacement and separation from their mothers can take a serious toll on the children left behind. Children with parents in prison run a high risk of ending up in jail themselves and often suffer from a host of psychological problems, from shame and anger to depression and ...
